Mini Cannoli Bites

Jump to Recipe

Indulge in the delightful world of Italian desserts with our Mini Cannoli Bites! These bite-sized treats are the perfect combination of crispy cannoli shells and a creamy, sweet ricotta filling, making them an irresistible treat for any occasion. Whether you're hosting a party, celebrating a special event, or simply craving a delicious dessert, these Mini Cannoli Bites are sure to impress your guests and satisfy your sweet tooth. With an easy-to-follow recipe, you can whip up these delectable bites in no time, and customize them with your favorite toppings, like chocolate chips and chopped pistachios. Join us as we guide you through the steps to create these delightful morsels that capture the essence of traditional Italian pastry in a fun, modern twist!

Ingredients

cannoli shells

If you can't find pre-made cannoli shells, you can substitute with phyllo dough or mini tart shells. For freshness, consider making your own shells using a simple dough recipe and frying them until golden brown.

ricotta cheese

Use whole milk ricotta for a creamier texture. If ricotta is too watery, drain it in a cheesecloth for a few hours before mixing. For a lighter alternative, consider using mascarpone cheese or a blend of ricotta and cream cheese.

powdered sugar

Powdered sugar is essential for sweetness and texture. If you need a substitute, you can blend granulated sugar in a blender until fine, but remember to adjust the quantity as it may be less sweet. You can also add a pinch of salt to enhance the sweetness.

vanilla extract

For a richer flavor, use pure vanilla extract instead of imitation. You can also experiment with other extracts like almond or hazelnut for a unique twist. If using whole vanilla beans, scrape the seeds from one pod for a more intense flavor.

chocolate chips

Semi-sweet chocolate chips are classic, but you can substitute with dark chocolate, white chocolate, or even flavored chips (like peanut butter). For a more gourmet touch, chop up a chocolate bar or use chocolate shavings.

chopped pistachios (for garnish)

If you don't have pistachios, consider using chopped almonds, hazelnuts, or walnuts as substitutes. For an added flavor boost, toast the nuts lightly before using them as a garnish to enhance their aroma and crunch.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Prepare the Filling

    In a mixing bowl, combine 1 cup of ricotta cheese, 1/2 cup of powdered sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla extract. Use a hand mixer or whisk to mix until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Make sure there are no lumps for a silky texture.

  • Step 2: Add Chocolate Chips

    Gently fold in 1/2 cup of chocolate chips into the ricotta mixture. Be careful not to overmix; you want to keep the chocolate chips intact for a delightful crunch.

  • Step 3: Fill the Cannoli Shells

    Using a piping bag fitted with a large round tip or a small spoon, carefully fill each of the 12 cannoli shells with the ricotta mixture. Fill them generously, but avoid overfilling to prevent spilling.

  • Step 4: Garnish with Pistachios

    Sprinkle 1/4 cup of chopped pistachios on the ends of each filled cannoli. This not only adds a beautiful touch but also adds a nutty flavor that complements the sweetness of the filling.

  • Step 5: Serve or Chill

    You can serve the mini cannoli bites immediately for a fresh taste, or you can chill them in the fridge for about 30 minutes to firm up the filling. Enjoy these delightful treats!

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare the cannoli shells for filling?

If you're using store-bought cannoli shells, they are typically ready to fill. Just make sure they are at room temperature. If you made them from scratch, allow them to cool completely before filling.

How can I make sure my ricotta mixture is smooth?

To achieve a smooth mixture, make sure your ricotta cheese is at room temperature before mixing. You can also blend it with a hand mixer or food processor for a creamier texture.

What if I don’t have chocolate chips?

You can substitute chocolate chips with mini chocolate chips, chopped chocolate bars, or even dried fruits like raisins or cranberries for a different flavor.

How do I fill the cannoli shells without making a mess?

Using a piping bag makes filling cannoli shells easier and neater. If you don’t have one, you can use a ziplock bag with the corner snipped off. Just be gentle while filling to avoid breaking the shells.

Can I make the filling ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the ricotta filling a day in advance. Just store it in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Fill the shells right before serving to keep them crisp.

How do I store leftover filled cannoli?

Filled cannoli are best enjoyed fresh. If you have leftovers, store them in the refrigerator but keep the shells separate from the filling to prevent them from becoming soggy.

What can I use instead of pistachios for garnish?

If you don’t have pistachios, you can use chopped almonds, hazelnuts, or even colorful sprinkles for a fun look.

How do I know when my cannoli bites are done?

Since cannoli bites are assembled rather than baked, you don't need to worry about cooking times. Just ensure the filling is smooth and the shells are crisp when you fill them.

What are some variations I can try with the filling?

You can experiment by adding flavors like orange zest, almond extract, or even different types of nuts and fruits to the filling for unique twists.

What's the best way to serve mini cannoli bites?

Serve them on a platter arranged neatly, and you can dust them with extra powdered sugar for a beautiful presentation. Enjoy with coffee or as a light dessert!

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

These Mini Cannoli Bites can be made gluten-free by sourcing gluten-free cannoli shells. For a dairy-free option, use a plant-based ricotta made from nuts or tofu. Adjust the sweetness by using a sugar substitute like erythritol or stevia for those watching their sugar intake.

Pairings

Pair these Mini Cannoli Bites with a sweet dessert wine such as a Moscato or a rich coffee like espresso. For a contrasting flavor, try them with a light herbal tea, which can balance the richness of the cannoli. They also pair well with fresh fruit, such as berries, that can provide a tart contrast to the sweetness of the filling.

Serving Suggestions

Serve Mini Cannoli Bites on an elegant platter, perhaps dusted with a light shower of cocoa powder or powdered sugar for visual appeal. For a touch of freshness, include a small bowl of fresh berries on the side. Consider using decorative toothpicks for easy handling. If serving at a party, consider a dessert table setup with various Italian sweets to complement the cannoli.

Mini Cannoli Bites

25 min
$7.5
250 kcal
Difficulty: 20%
Servings: 6

Allergens:

DairyGlutenNuts

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

Italian

Course:

Dessert

Tags:

DessertItalianSweet

Description

Deliciously creamy and crunchy, these mini cannoli bites are filled with sweet ricotta and chocolate chips.

Ingredients

  • cannoli shells: 12
  • ricotta cheese: 1 cup
  • powdered sugar: 1/2 cup
  • vanilla extract: 1 tsp
  • chocolate chips: 1/2 cup
  • chopped pistachios (for garnish): 1/4 cup

11/17/2024
